intro: Commelina hispida var. gaudichaudii, commonly known as the hairy commelina, is a flowering plant belonging to the Commelinaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, hairy textures. The plant produces clusters of small, blue-violet flowers that are borne on short, terminal spikes. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. This variant is distinguished by its more robust growth and dense foliage compared to other members of the species.
